content: The "Consular Review Act of 1996" establishes a Board of Visa Appeals under the Immigration and Nationality Act. The Consular Review Act of 1996 establishes a Board of Visa Appeals within the Department of State, composed of 5 members appointed by the Secretary of State. The Board has authority to review discretionary decisions of consular officers regarding immigrant and nonimmigrant visas, petitions, and waiver applications.
